There has always been differences of opinion among Ulama on various Shar'ee%0D%0Arulings. A distinct example is that of the different rulings among the four%0D%0Aillustrious Fuqahaa (jurists); Imaam Nu'maan ibn Thaabit Abu Hanifa, Imaam%0D%0AMuhammad ibn Idrees Shaaf'ee, Imaam Maalik ibn Anas Maalik, Imaam Ahmad ibn%0D%0AHanbal.%0D%0A%0D%0AEach one of the four was an ocean of knowledge and had the necessary skills%0D%0Aand requirements to deduce rulings from the Qur'aan and Hadith in matters%0D%0Anot express and explicit in the Qur'aan and Hadith. As Muqallids, we place%0D%0Aour trust in the deductions of one particular Imaam, and follow his ruling%0D%0Aon any given matter. The Ulama of today are also bound by the rulings of any%0D%0Aone Imaam. They do not have the qualifications like anyone of the four%0D%0Aillustrious Imaams and neither is their drops of knowledge comparable to the%0D%0Avast oceans of knowledge of the illustrious Fuqahaa.%0D%0A%0D%0AIt may well be that a person not having the necessary qualification issue a%0D%0Aruling and creates confusion in the mind of simple minded but sincere%0D%0Apeople. It is precisely for this reason that Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi%0D%0AWasallam) advised, 'Verily this knowledge (of Shari'ah) is Deen (religion),%0D%0Aso be careful from who you seek your religion.' (Mishkaat vol.1 Chapter of%0D%0AKnowledge).%0D%0A%0D%0AReverting to the original question, Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam)%0D%0Aprohibited from lowering the pants below the ankle. The prohibition is%0D%0Ageneral, for Salaat and out of Salaat. However, the intensity of the%0D%0Aprohibition is more in Salaat. Ideally and in principle, a person should not%0D%0Awear trousers below the ankles, but if a person is wearing such a trousers,%0D%0Ait is either the person performs Salaat by folding his pants above the%0D%0Aankles to comply with the Hadith prohibiting the flow of the pants below the%0D%0Aankles, thus, making his Salaat Makrooh. Surely, folding the pants is the%0D%0Asolution to avoiding the sin. There is no Hadith prohibiting folding the%0D%0Apants. Any such reference is a distortion of people ignorant of Hadith. We%0D%0Ahope the above answers your query.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai
